RumorFact.Text: I read that one of the Nomai was studying the alien's language in some sort of lab. It has an entrance near Shattered Hearth, above the park with the big tree.
The entrance seems to be too small for me to fit my ship.
There are a bunch of baby anglerfish directly blocking the path to the lab.
I read that the translation lab has a larger entrance somewhere in Briar's Hollow. A Nomai who needed to find it left a temporary beacon at the lab, which then guided them to the larger entrance.
The Nomai hypothesized that anglerfish might not be able to distinguish between organic and inorganic prey.

ExploreFact.Text: I was able to get the baby anglerfish to latch onto my ship so that I could get past.
One of the Nomai observed a massive anglerfish residing near the translation lab. He theorized that, due to its size, it would starve if the Dree did not continue to feed it.
The Nomai in charge of the translations, Sennetti, determined that the aliens referred to themselves as the Dree.
Sennetti worked heavily with a Dree who referred to himself as Ditylum, who was also the first Dree that the Nomai encountered.
The Dree referred to this whole area as the Deep Bramble, and the plant itself simply as the Bramble.
Apparently the Dree are talented in druidcraft, giving them some level of influence over the Bramble.
My translator was able to download a Dree dictionary that Sennetti translated.
The Dree revealed to the Nomai that they did not know of any way to escape the Deep Bramble.
